## Review

_Congratulations, you've completed this exercise and learned how to create a digital collection website with CollectionBuilder!_ üéâ

<img src="https://octodex.github.com/images/jetpacktocat.png" alt="celebrate" width=200 align=right>

Here's a recap of your accomplishments:

- ‚úÖ **Set up a development environment** in GitHub Codespaces
- ‚úÖ **Learned Git version control** using VS Code's Source Control panel
- ‚úÖ **Explored CSV metadata** and how it drives digital collections
- ‚úÖ **Edited collection metadata** to customize items
- ‚úÖ **Configured Jekyll** to use your metadata
- ‚úÖ **Built and previewed** your collection locally with Ruby and Bundle
- ‚úÖ **Customized content** using Markdown
- ‚úÖ **Deployed to GitHub Pages** for free public hosting

Your digital collection is now live on the web! üåê

### Technical Skills Learned

Through this tutorial, you've gained foundational skills in:

- **Git version control**: Staging, committing, and syncing changes using VS Code
- **GitHub Codespaces**: Cloud-based development environments
- **Metadata management**: Working with CSV files and understanding metadata fields
- **Command-line basics**: Using the terminal for Jekyll and Bundle commands
- **Jekyll & Ruby**: Static site generation
- **Markdown**: Simple markup for formatted content
- **GitHub Pages**: Static site hosting and deployment

### What's next?

**Explore CollectionBuilder Documentation:**
- **[CSV Metadata](https://collectionbuilder.github.io/cb-docs/docs/metadata/csv_metadata/)** - Learn about required and optional metadata fields, formatting guidelines, and best practices
- **[Google Sheets Workflow](https://collectionbuilder.github.io/cb-docs/docs/metadata/googsheets/)** - Set up a collaborative metadata workflow using Google Sheets
- **[Theme Customization](https://collectionbuilder.github.io/cb-docs/docs/theme/)** - Customize colors, fonts, and styles in `_data/theme.yml`
- **[Configuration](https://collectionbuilder.github.io/cb-docs/docs/config/)** - Explore all `_config.yml` options
- **[Pages](https://collectionbuilder.github.io/cb-docs/docs/pages/)** - Add and customize content pages
- **[Advanced Features](https://collectionbuilder.github.io/cb-docs/docs/advanced/)** - Compound objects, featured items, and more

**Customize Your Collection:**
- Add more items to your CSV metadata (try creating a few in Google Sheets!)
- Customize theme colors in `_data/theme.yml`
- Modify page layouts and includes
- Add custom content pages
- Experiment with different metadata fields (subjects, locations, dates)

**Join the Community:**
- Ask questions in the [CollectionBuilder Discussion Forum](https://github.com/CollectionBuilder/collectionbuilder.github.io/discussions)
- Share your collection with the community
- Explore example collections on the [CollectionBuilder website](https://collectionbuilder.github.io/)

**Build Your Own Collection:**
- Apply what you've learned to create a collection from your own materials!
- Check out the [CollectionBuilder Tutorials](https://collectionbuilder.github.io/cb-docs/docs/walkthroughs/) for more guidance
- Read the [Getting Started Guide](https://collectionbuilder.github.io/cb-docs/) for creating a new collection from scratch

### Additional Resources

- [CollectionBuilder Documentation](https://collectionbuilder.github.io/cb-docs/)
- [Jekyll Documentation](https://jekyllrb.com/docs/)
- [GitHub Skills](https://skills.github.com/) - More interactive tutorials
- [Markdown Guide](https://www.markdownguide.org/)
- [Git Handbook](https://guides.github.com/introduction/git-handbook/)
- [Google Sheets](https://www.google.com/sheets/about/) - Free collaborative spreadsheet tool

### Share Your Success!

We'd love to see what you've built! Share your collection URL and tag CollectionBuilder on social media, or post in the [Discussion Forum](https://github.com/CollectionBuilder/collectionbuilder.github.io/discussions).

Thanks for learning with CollectionBuilder! üöÄ
